item.title: Basics
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min.

This is in continuation with the previous post. We are going to look at how the data sample is done and what could cause variation in it. 1.2. Data, Sampling, and Variation in Data and Sampling As mentioned earlier, it is generally not feasible to collect data from entire population. Data can be collected from “Sample” inside the population. But the statistician has to make sure that the sample covers all the variations in the population.

Statistics is still a complex limbo to many. When I first read the book, the ease of sharing logic was so awesome that I have kept it as one of my prized collections. Offlate, I have started reading it again and I guess it is going to be great if I can share the details of the journey with my fellow enthusiasts.
